_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Overview:
In 1970 Leo J. Diamond and William P. Cunningham Sr. founded Astro Chemicals Inc., with one purpose: commitment to the customer. Every order had their personal promise of 100% customer satisfaction. Today, our promise remains the same. Though the world's greater demands for environmental responsibility and business efficiencies create a broader sense of commitment, this challenge has only strengthened our resolve. 

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:
Astro Chemicals' approach to chemical safety starts at the beginning with a New Product / Process Change Review. This includes input by the sales person, purchasing, quality control and the regulatory department to identify the hazards of a product to determine if Astro can safely store, transport, or in some cases repackage for Astros' customer(s).  To move forward Astro will then communicate the requirements to the operations personnel in one of three ways: through a new or existing written procedure, the development of a check list, or verbal instruction.  Managerial over site is provided on a case by case basis.

Astro prevention program is centered on good warehousing practices as mandated by the National Association of Chemical Distributors Responsible Distribution which can be found at http://www.nacd.com/dist_process/National Association of Chemical Distributors 

Responsible Distribution Code of Management Practice 
Each member company shall have an active program designed to continuously improve safety and reduce incidents. This Code does not impose upon member companies any obligation to guarantee compliance by third parties, i.e., parties over whom the member companies have no control. This program shall include:  
I. Risk Management 
II. Compliance Review and Training 
III. Carrier Selection 
IV. Handling and Storage 
V. Job Procedures and Training 
VI. Waste Management and Conservation Practices 
VII. Emergency Response and Public Preparedness 
VIII. C

ommunity Outreach 
IX. Product Stewardship 
X. Internal Audits
XI. Corrective and Preventive Action 
XII. Document and Records Control 

Astro Chemicals and the Regulated Substances:
Astro as a Chemical Distributor has been successfully handling both Ammonia and Hydrochloric Acid 37% in quantities below threshold along with other regulated chemicals.  Ammonia and Hydrochloric Acid 37% are currently logistics and warehousing opportunity for Astro. However, Hydrochloric Acid 37% is not bulk off-loaded from cargo tankers or railcar tankers.

General Accidental Release Prevention Program: 
The combination of Responsible Distribution® and Astro's Quality Management System has established written procedures, checklists, internal audits, and training review of safe repackaging, storage and distribution of chemicals at both facilities.  Frequent safety meetings are held for all warehouse shifts including monthly drivers' hours of service review.  Astro additionally provides updates to employees of applicable rules, regulations, customer needs and trends that are in need of attention.  These all serve as training sessions to a variety of regulatory requirements.  Astro feels that it is a responsible corporate member of the Springfield business community and has the welfare of our employees and neighbors at heart.

Five Year Accident History:
There have been no accidents or releases of the two proposed regulated chemicals.  

The Emergency Response Program:
Astro is active with the Springfield LEPC and the other industrial facilities in the area to promote Responsible Care and Responsible Distribution.  Astro has an emergency plan that is reviewed and updated including practice drills for its employees. There are spill response kits though out the facility.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety:
Astro practices continuous improvement in all aspects of the operation.  The frequent safety /quality /process meetings are a method to communicate to operations p
ersonnel needed changes and gather input from them to make operations safer.  Astro's use of leased material handling equipment allows Astro to have well maintained and current equipment.
